title: Mental Models Explained
content: A mental model is your internal representation of how a system works. It includes components, relationships, normal states, and expected behaviors. The accuracy of your mental model determines how well you understand what you perceive. Inaccurate models lead to misinterpretationâ€”you see something but draw the wrong conclusions because your model is wrong.

mcq.question: An operator has a detailed mental model of how a pump system works. When they see unusual vibration, they immediately consider bearing failure. An operator without this model might see the same vibration and think nothing of it. What does this illustrate?

options.B: Mental models enable comprehension of perceived cues
options.C: Vibration is always a sign of bearing failure
options.D: New operators should be more concerned about equipment

mcq.explanation: The detailed mental model allows the experienced operator to comprehend what vibration might mean. Without the model, the same perception doesn't lead to understanding.

openQuestions: How accurate is your mental model of the systems you operate? How do you know?
What gaps exist in your mental models that you should address?
